author: mango1144
body:
My plan today was: 

Buy SPY puts at the morning peak, sell at the morning dip and load up on calls.

What happened instead:

Bought SPY puts at 306.5 this morning. Stared at my screen for 45 minutes waiting for the drop until I nodded off and fell asleep (I work nights).

Slept through my 12:50pm alarm and woke up at 1:05pm in a panic down 50% on my puts.

Broke even at least since I also bought DXC at open.

I was going to do a quick turnaround this AM after I saw it bounce up but decided against it... fucker's still climbing, so I'm not sure whether I want to hold for a bit longer or just take the gains now. I can't find it, but someone posted a huge DD on Monday about how DXC will hit 20 before these expire. I'm up 62%, which feels nice, but then again biggers numbers are bigger...

>The alternative is just waking up to me and, well, not the best alternative.

Amazing how attractive money can make you, eh? ;)

author: ClosedGuard
body: I know that its up 6% right now but do not let fomo hit you then you end up buying high. Ive made this mistake plenty. All these cruises and airlines have been pump and dump since the covid. Buy on the dump. Keep your research up too though and dont be discouraged. If you are really uncomfortable and feel like you want another stock to buy. Buy into dxc. They got hit 14% on friday on weak earnings. They are up 1% today. That 14% will be gained back once people get over the weak report. Just about all earning reports are sucking. Its actually my favorite time to buy. But strong companies. Good luck

-RNO.PA

author: rdupuy
body:
When the market went down 1800 points last week, I bought call options for rf, dxc, and ncr.  July and September calls.  3800 bet that paid 1000 or so.

I typically stay more in small cap financial equities, and frankly the main credit union stock I invest in barely ever moves.  Didn't budge on that dip.  About the same today.... it did go down in March, so maybe someday it goes back up.  But central banks are NOT pumping money into this stock, and you cannot leverage it, so not finding much love as yet.
